== Introduction ==

Brasero is a CD and DVD writing ('burning') application. Since Ubuntu 8.04, it has been installed by default.

=== Usage ===
Applications > Sound & Video > Brasero Disc Burning

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;" style="border:none;margin-right:5px;"><nowiki>[[attachment:brasero-main-full.png|<nowiki>[[File:brasero-main-small.png|Brasero Startup Page]]</nowiki></nowiki>]]
| <style="border:none;"><nowiki>[[attachment:brasero-dataproject-full.png|<nowiki>[[File:brasero-dataproject-small.png|Brasero Data Project]]</nowiki></nowiki>]]
|}

The startup screen shows different projects and other tasks you can start.
The main ones allow you to burn:
* Data discs
* Audio discs
* Video discs
* Disk 'images' (e.g. Linux distributions)
* Copies of discs
Brasero can erase a rewritable disc so it can be used again: Tools > Erase...
There is also a basic cover editor available: Tools > Cover Editor.
=== Hints & Tips ===
There are four plugins that come with Brasero by default in Ubuntu:
* File Checksum - check the integrity of files on a disc.
* Image Checksum - check the integrity of a disc image.
* local-track - lets you burn network files.
* normalize - gives audio CDs have a consistent sound level.

== Installation ==
Part of the default installation since Ubuntu 8.04. For earlier versions of Ubuntu, the <code>brasero</code> package can <nowiki>[[InstallingSoftware#Ubuntu|be installed]]</nowiki>.
